thread.title: Amtrak train derails after clipping another train at Penn Station | New York Post
thread.title_full: Amtrak train derails after clipping another train at Penn Station | New York Post

author: Danielle Furfaro
title: Amtrak train derails after clipping another train at Penn Station | New York Post
text:
Another angle of our damaged #njtransit train, with lower level windows punched in pic.twitter.com/tFM5KSkYYK 
— David W. Chen (@davidwchen) March 24, 2017 

An Amtrak train derailed Friday morning at Penn Station when it collided with a New Jersey transit train, witnesses and sources said.
There were no immediate reports of serious injuries.
“So my train was just clipped by another train as we pulled into Penn Station…” Jason Lynch, a TV writer for AdWeek, posted on Twitter at 9:09 a.m. along with showing the side of a damaged train.
In a follow-up tweet, Lynch said, “thankfully, everyone seems to be okay. Can’t figure out how it happened, or how the damage wasn’t much worse.”
New Jersey Transit passenger Jordan Geary riding on the Montclair-Boonton Line said the train window “blew out” onto him after the collision.
“My @NJTRANSIT train just collided with another oncoming train. Blew my window out and into me. Thankfully everyone is okay,” Geary tweeted .
“I can confirm that one of the trains in the collision today was my Montclair/Boonton line @NJTRANSIT train. No idea of the departing train,” Geary posted.
He said “what happened today was scary as hell.”
Twitter user @SareveChante tweeted , “Train I was supposed to be on just derailed in penn station. Praying everyone aboard is okay.”
@Amtrak #derailed between 2nd and third car #acela #newyork to #Washington pic.twitter.com/6YNCgZGjHD 
— lo (@ilonacohen) March 24, 2017 

Passengers headed for Penn Station reported on the social-media site that their trains were “backing up” as a result of the incident.
NJ Transit said that all of its trains are suspended going in and out of Penn Station and Midtown trains were being rerouted to Hoboken.
MTA officials said there was no impact to Long Island Rail Road trains.
